Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull (small part of neck, shoulder and body, with patch of added red on body and shoulder), to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos mistakenly identifies the animal as a boar. For parallels regarding bulls, see Lemos pl. 82, no. 643.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 256, no. 452, pl. 61) (incorrectly labelled as 1888.6-1.471.b.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0518) (phase 2)
